column4: hi all, i've a problem, i've an Epson Stylus CX-3650 and i followed this: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=17314 and this http://gentoo-wiki.com/HARDWARE_EPSON_CX3650_&_DX3850 guide, printer work, but scanner don't! i don't have /etc/hotplug/ so i cannot follow that guides.. if i try apt-get install hotplug it say that udev and module-init-tools substitute it
can anybody help me? why i don't have /etc/hotplug? how can i "install" it?
can anybody help me?
please
surel
ask away
tnx... i've already asked... i don't have the /etc/hotplug directory (ubuntu 6.06 fresh install) i need it for setting up my scanner
but if i try apt-get install hotplug it say that there's udev and module-init-tools that substitute it
i don't beleive you need that directory anymore, let me look
watch my link
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=26911
it explains about firmware, for your scanner, and how to get it working
wait i read it
are you sure? i don't find CX 3650 there
it doesn't matter the make, you have to follow the same steps to get the firmware working,
just use the same steps, but for your scanner
i don't have a firmware (.bin)
you can prolly find it on the cd that came with your scanner, or online, at their website
hey mate! my scanner work.. i simply follower the first part of the tutoria i gave you (editing /etc/sane.d/epson.conf) and then i rebooted
awsome, you should post a forum about it, to help others
i would like.. but i have to register...
